org.akubraproject.qsc
Class QuiescingBlobStore

java.lang.Object
  org.akubraproject.impl.AbstractBlobStore
      org.akubraproject.qsc.QuiescingBlobStore
All Implemented Interfaces:
org.akubraproject.BlobStore
public class QuiescingBlobStore
extends org.akubraproject.impl.AbstractBlobStore

Provide quiescing capability to a stack. While quiescent, all writes and updates are blocked, but read operations are still allowed.

This implementation is transaction aware: when asked to quiesce, it will wait for all transactions with modifications to complete. It will allow new transactions to begin, but will block all updates.

Author:
Ronald Tschal√§r

IOException

setQuiescent

public boolean setQuiescent(boolean quiescent)
                     throws IOException
Makes the stack quiescent or non-quiescent.

When going from non-quiescent to quiescent, this call blocks until all active writes and all transactions with writes have completed and any caches have been flushed. While in the quiescent state, the stack will continue to honor read requests, but will block all write requests including moves and deletes.

This method is idempotent.

Parameters:
quiescent - whether to go into the quiescent (true) or non-quiescent (false) state.
Returns:
true if successful, false if the thread was interrupted while blocking.
Throws:
IOException - if an error occurred trying to quiesce the stack.
